w:r.w:t: The teacher will teach basic vacation words by using TPR, sentence frames, and vocabulary. Students will study these words and phrases: Where do I want to go? Let’s go to the beach, Let’s go to Paris, beach, hotel, swim, relax, pictures, sandcastle, metro
At completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
Recognize, spell, and pronounce the words for vacation words
Spell and pronounce common associated words
Use sets of words in complete sentences
Word List: beach, hotel, swim, relax, pictures
This slide will always be the Naativ-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: “Today, we are going to be learning about vacation words.”
Talk about a vacation you went on
with the child. Remind them that a vacation is a place you can go rest (act out rest) or see new things (act out see).
If the child can, encourage the child to share what they know about vacationing.
Where do I want to go?
Circle the picture, underline the sentence and say,
Where do I want to go?
Visual cue: Show printed out pictures of the
beach, pyramids, Eiffel tower, desert, etc.
Ask, “What place do you like?” (while giving a thumbs-up).
I can go to the beach or to Paris.
Circle the picture of the Eiffel Tower and say,
Underline the complete bold phrase and say,
I can go to the beach or Paris
Let’s go to the beach! I need to pack.
Circle things you should pack for the beach trip. Say the name of the items.
Circle the first picture and say,
Let’s go to the beach! I need to pack
and have the child repeat. Circle the suitcase and review the word
which was taught in the previous vacation lesson.
Underline the next bold sentence and ask,
Tell the child to circle some things we should pack for the beach. Say the name of the items and have the child repeat. It is not necessary the child learn the name of all of these items.
I need to get a hotel.
Circle the picture of the hotel and say,
I need to get a hotel
Talk about the hotel. Model counting the floors and see if the child can tell you how many floors the hotel has.
I want to swim at the beach.
and do the action. Have the child repeat.
I want to swim at the beach.
Have the child repeat. Ask the child if they like (put a thumbs-up for the word
I want to relax at the beach.
Circle the boy relaxing and underline the word,
and put your hands behind your head (like the boy in the picture) to act out the word relax. Have the child repeat.
I want to relax at the beach.
I want to make a sandcastle
Circle the sandcastle, and say the word. Say,
I want to make a sandcastle
Draw a castle off to the side. Encourage the child to draw a castle too.
Write the missing word in the sentence.
Encourage the students to write the words we’ve practiced reading and spelling on the lines. Help them as needed.
Let’s go to Paris ! I need to pack.
Circle things you should pack for the Paris trip. Say the name of the items.
Circle the first picture and say,
Let’s go to Paris! I need to pack
and have the child repeat. Circle the suitcase and review the word
Underline the next bold sentence and ask,
Tell the child to circle some things we should pack for the Paris trip. Say the name of the items and have the child repeat. It is not necessary the child learn the name of all of these items.
I need to get a hotel.
Circle the picture of the hotel and say,
again and have the child repeat.
I need to get a hotel
Talk about the hotel. Model counting the floors and see if the child can tell you how many floors the hotel has.
I need to take the metro in Paris.
I need to take the metro in Paris.
I want to take pictures in Paris
Circle the picture and explain that the girls are taking a selfie, a picture of themselves. Explain that this is called,
and pretend to click a camera.
I want to take pictures in Paris
while pretending to take a picture.
I want to drink coffee in Paris.
Circle the picture and ask what they are doing. Encourage the child to say the verb they should know,
I want to drink coffee in Paris
Draw a line from the picture to the column
Say each picture in a complete phrase (
I want to drink coffee in Paris, I need to take the metro, I want to take pictures)
Model drawing a line from the people drinking coffee to the
I want to drink coffee in Paris.
Encourage the child to draw lines for the other pictures and say their complete phrases.
by holding your hands up in a questioning way. Have the child repeat
in an answering way. Have the child repeat.
Why do you like the beach
Underline and read the first question,
with a thumbs-up and the swimming action). Have the child repeat.
Underline and read the first question,
with a thumbs-up and the clicking camera action). Have the child repeat.
